meaningInfo: Your <radical>scooter</radical> takes you to the <radical>barracks</radical>, <radical>drop</radical>s you off, and then goes in <kanji>reverse</kanji> all the way back home in the <kanji>opposite</kanji> direction.
readingMnemonic: Imagine riding your scooter to the barracks. It literally drops you on the ground when you get there, and then drives in reverse back the opposite way you came.
readingInfo: Your scooter going in reverse and leaving you here is opposite of what you want. You want to ride it back home when you're done, so you stuff the wheels with Gak (ぎゃく). If you don’t know what Gak is, check out this Gak commercial.
